roles.definition: People with lived experience of disability, who are independent or a part of a disability organization, who will consult with Entities on their accessibility plan. This also includes caregivers and parents.
Consultants who represent a constituency group. They are appointed by the group, or matched by the Social Enterprise.
Any organization that is regulated by the federal government under the Accessible Canada Act.
Any organization that serves the disability community.
This can be a family member, friend, or someone trained to provide care. They act as a liaison between entity and consultant, and ensures safety and well-being of the consultant.
This can be anyone the consultant has picked as someone who can provide support to them. The support person does not act as the liaison.
The group that supports the consultation process and is responsible for service delivery.
People who are members of the disability community and/or other under-represented communities, who will do outreach to potential consultants and support them to become consultants

A trained group of people with lived experience of disability and intersectionality. They ensure representation of consultants on projects, and provides and mentorship to the consultants during the consultation process.
Trained individuals who conducts and facilitates the consultation the behalf of Federally Regulated Entities.
